query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
1 Mentre che li occhi per la fronda verde 2 ficcava ïo sì come far suole 3 chi dietro a li uccellin sua vita perde,
4 lo più che padre mi dicea: «Figliuole, 5 vienne oramai, ché ’l tempo che n’è imposto 6 più utilmente compartir si vuole».
query.result:
**English:**
1 While my eyes were fixed on the green leaves, 2 as one who loses his life following the birds, 3 my father said to me: "My son, 4 come now, for the time that is allotted to us 5 should be spent more usefully."
**Malay:**
1 Sementara mataku terpaku pada dedaunan hijau, 2 seperti orang yang kehilangan nyawanya mengikuti burung-burung, 3 ayahku berkata kepadaku: "Anakku, 4 datanglah sekarang, karena waktu yang diberikan kepada kita 5 harus digunakan dengan lebih bermanfaat."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
7 Io volsi ’l viso, e ’l passo non men tosto, 8 appresso i savi, che parlavan sìe, 9 che l’andar mi facean di nullo costo.
query.result:
**English:**
7 I turned my face, and my steps no less swiftly, 8 after the wise men, who spoke so, 9 that their going made my going of no cost.
**Malay:**
7 Aku memalingkan wajahku, dan langkahku tidak kurang cepatnya, 8 mengikuti orang-orang bijak, yang berbicara demikian, 9 sehingga perjalanan mereka membuat perjalananku tidak ada artinya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
10 Ed ecco piangere e cantar s’udìe 11 ‘Labïa mëa, Domine’ per modo 12 tal, che diletto e doglia parturìe.
query.result:
**English:**
10 And behold, weeping and singing were heard, 11 “Labia mea, Domine” in such a way 12 that it produced delight and sorrow.
**Malay:**
10 Dan lihatlah, tangisan dan nyanyian terdengar, 11 “Labia mea, Domine” dengan cara sedemikian rupa 12 sehingga menghasilkan kesenangan dan kesedihan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
13 «O dolce padre, che è quel ch’i’ odo?», 14 comincia’ io; ed elli: «Ombre che vanno 15 forse di lor dover solvendo il nodo».
query.result:
**English:**
13 "O sweet father, what is that I hear?", 14 I began; and he: "Shades who go 15 perhaps absolving the knot of their duty".
**Malay:**
13 "Wahai ayah yang manis, apakah yang kudengar itu?", 14 mulailah aku; dan dia: "Bayangan-bayangan yang pergi 15 mungkin membebaskan diri dari ikatan kewajiban mereka".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
16 Sì come i peregrin pensosi fanno, 17 giugnendo per cammin gente non nota, 18 che si volgono ad essa e non restanno,
19 così di retro a noi, più tosto mota, 20 venendo e trapassando ci ammirava 21 d’anime turba tacita e devota.
query.result:
**English:**
16 Just as thoughtful pilgrims do, 17 arriving on a road where people are unknown, 18 who turn to look at them and do not stop,
19 so behind us, rather slowly, 20 coming and passing by, a crowd of silent and devout 21 souls gazed at us in wonder.
**Malay:**
16 Sama seperti para peziarah yang termenung, 17 tiba di jalan di mana orang-orang tidak dikenal, 18 yang menoleh untuk melihat mereka dan tidak berhenti,
19 begitu juga di belakang kami, agak lambat, 20 datang dan lewat, sekumpulan jiwa yang diam dan saleh 21 menatap kami dengan heran.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
22 Ne li occhi era ciascuna oscura e cava, 23 palida ne la faccia, e tanto scema 24 che da l’ossa la pelle s’informava.
query.result:
**English:**
22 In their eyes each one was dark and hollow, 23 pale in the face, and so wasted 24 that the skin clung to their bones.
**Malay:**
22 Di mata mereka masing-masing gelap dan cekung, 23 pucat di wajah, dan sangat kurus 24 sehingga kulit menempel di tulang mereka.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
25 Non credo che così a buccia strema 26 Erisittone fosse fatto secco, 27 per digiunar, quando più n’ebbe tema.
query.result:
**English:**
25 I do not believe that Erysichthon was made so thin 26 and dried out, 27 through fasting, when he most feared it.
**Malay:**
25 Aku tidak percaya bahwa Erysichthon menjadi begitu kurus kering 26 dan layu, 27 karena berpuasa, ketika ia paling takut akan hal itu.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
28 Io dicea fra me stesso pensando: ‘Ecco 29 la gente che perdé Ierusalemme, 30 quando Maria nel figlio diè di becco!’
31 Parean l’occhiaie anella sanza gemme: 32 chi nel viso de li uomini legge ‘omo’ 33 ben avria quivi conosciuta l’emme.
query.result:
**English:**
28 I said to myself, thinking: ‘Behold 29 the people who lost Jerusalem, 30 when Mary gave her Son a kiss!’
31 Their eye sockets looked like rings without gems: 32 whoever reads ‘man’ in the face of men 33 would have recognized the letter ‘M’ here.
**Malay:**
28 Aku berkata pada diriku sendiri sambil berpikir: ‘Lihatlah, 29 orang-orang yang kehilangan Yerusalem, 30 ketika Maria mencium Putranya!’
31 Rongga mata mereka tampak seperti cincin tanpa permata: 32 siapa pun yang membaca ‘manusia’ di wajah manusia 33 pasti akan mengenali huruf ‘M’ di sini.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
34 Chi crederebbe che l’odor d’un pomo 35 sì governasse, generando brama, 36 e quel d’un’acqua, non sappiendo como?
37 Già era in ammirar che sì li affama, 38 per la cagione ancor non manifesta 39 di lor magrezza e di lor trista squama,
40 ed ecco del profondo de la testa 41 volse a me li occhi un’ombra e guardò fiso; 42 poi gridò forte: «Qual grazia m’è questa?».
query.result:
**English:**
34 Who would believe that the scent of an apple 35 could rule so much, generating desire, 36 and that of water, not knowing how?
37 I was already marveling at what so famished them, 38 for the cause of their thinness and their sad scales 39 was not yet apparent,
40 and behold, from the depths of its head 41 a shade turned its eyes to me and stared intently; 42 then it cried out loudly: "What grace is this for me?".
**Malay:**
34 Siapa yang akan percaya bahawa bau sebiji epal 35 boleh memerintah sedemikian rupa, membangkitkan keinginan, 36 dan bau air, tanpa mengetahui caranya?
37 Aku sudah kagum melihat apa yang membuat mereka begitu lapar, 38 kerana punca kurus mereka dan sisik mereka yang menyedihkan 39 belum lagi jelas,
40 dan lihatlah, dari kedalaman kepalanya 41 satu bayangan mengalihkan pandangannya kepadaku dan menatap tajam; 42 kemudian ia berseru dengan kuat: "Kurnia apakah ini bagiku?".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
43 Mai non l’avrei riconosciuto al viso; 44 ma ne la voce sua mi fu palese 45 ciò che l’aspetto in sé avea conquiso.
query.result:
**English:**
43 I would never have recognized him by his face; 44 but in his voice it was revealed to me 45 what his appearance had conquered in itself.
**Malay:**
43 Aku tidak akan pernah mengenalinya dari wajahnya; 44 tetapi dalam suaranya, menjadi jelas bagiku 45 apa yang telah ditaklukkan oleh penampilannya dalam dirinya sendiri.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
46 Questa favilla tutta mi raccese 47 mia conoscenza a la cangiata labbia, 48 e ravvisai la faccia di Forese.
query.result:
**English:**
46 This spark rekindled all of me, 47 my knowledge changed my appearance, 48 and I recognized Forese's face.
**Malay:**
46 Percikan api ini menyalakan kembali seluruh diriku, 47 pengetahuanku mengubah penampilanku, 48 dan aku mengenali wajah Forese.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
55 «La faccia tua, ch’io lagrimai già morta, 56 mi dà di pianger mo non minor doglia», 57 rispuos’ io lui, «veggendola sì torta.
query.result:
**English:**
55 "Your face, which I once saw dead and wept for, 56 now gives me no less grief to see it so contorted," 57 I replied to him, "seeing it so twisted.
**Malay:**
55 "Wajahmu, yang pernah kulihat mati dan k menangisi, 56 sekarang memberiku kesedihan yang tidak sedikit untuk melihatnya begitu terpelintir," 57 jawabku kepadanya, "melihatnya begitu bengkok.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
58 Però mi dì, per Dio, che sì vi sfoglia; 59 non mi far dir mentr’ io mi maraviglio, 60 ché mal può dir chi è pien d’altra voglia».
query.result:
**English:**
58 But tell me, for God's sake, who strips you so; 59 do not make me speak while I am wondering, 60 for he who is full of other desire can speak poorly.
**Malay:**
58 Tetapi katakan padaku, demi Tuhan, yang begitu menelanjangimu; 59 jangan membuatku berbicara sementara aku bertanya-tanya, 60 karena orang yang penuh dengan keinginan lain dapat berbicara dengan buruk.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
61 Ed elli a me: «De l’etterno consiglio 62 cade vertù ne l’acqua e ne la pianta 63 rimasa dietro ond’ io sì m’assottiglio.
query.result:
**English:**
61 And he to me: "From the eternal counsel 62 virtue falls into the water and into the plant 63 left behind from which I so waste away.
**Malay:**
61 Dan dia kepadaku: "Dari nasihat abadi 62 kebajikan jatuh ke dalam air dan ke dalam tumbuhan 63 tertinggal di belakang dari mana aku sangat kurus.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
64 Tutta esta gente che piangendo canta 65 per seguitar la gola oltra misura, 66 in fame e ’n sete qui si rifà santa.
query.result:
**English:**
64 All these people who weep as they sing, 65 for following gluttony beyond measure, 66 here make themselves holy in hunger and thirst.
**Malay:**
64 Semua orang ini yang menangis sambil bernyanyi, 65 karena mengikuti kerakusan tanpa batas, 66 di sini menyucikan diri mereka dalam kelaparan dan dahaga.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
67 Di bere e di mangiar n’accende cura 68 l’odor ch’esce del pomo e de lo sprazzo 69 che si distende su per sua verdura.
query.result:
**English:**
67 The smell that issues from the fruit and from the spray 68 that spreads over its verdure kindles in them 69 a desire to eat and to gather it.
**Malay:**
67 Bau yang keluar dari buah dan semburan 68 yang menyebar di atas hijaunya membangkitkan dalam diri mereka 69 keinginan untuk makan dan memetiknya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
70 E non pur una volta, questo spazzo 71 girando, si rinfresca nostra pena: 72 io dico pena, e dovria dir sollazzo,
73 ché quella voglia a li alberi ci mena 74 che menò Cristo lieto a dire ‘Elì’, 75 quando ne liberò con la sua vena».
query.result:
**English:**
70 And not just once, this space 71 revolving, refreshes our pain: 72 I say pain, and should say solace,
73 for that desire leads us to the trees 74 that led Christ, joyful, to say ‘Eli’, 75 when he freed us with his blood.
**Malay:**
70 Dan bukan hanya sekali, ruang ini 71 berputar, menyegarkan penderitaan kita: 72 kukatakan penderitaan, dan seharusnya kukatakan kesenangan,
73 karena keinginan itu membawa kita ke pohon-pohon 74 yang membawa Kristus dengan gembira untuk berkata ‘Eli’, 75 ketika ia membebaskan kita dengan darahnya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
76 E io a lui: «Forese, da quel dì 77 nel qual mutasti mondo a miglior vita, 78 cinqu’ anni non son vòlti infino a qui.
query.result:
**English:**
76 And I to him: "Forese, since that day 77 when you changed worlds to a better life, 78 five years have not yet passed until now.
**Malay:**
76 Dan aku kepadanya: "Forese, sejak hari itu 77 ketika kamu mengubah dunia ke kehidupan yang lebih baik, 78 lima tahun belum berlalu sampai sekarang.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
79 Se prima fu la possa in te finita 80 di peccar più, che sovvenisse l’ora 81 del buon dolor ch’a Dio ne rimarita,
82 come se’ tu qua sù venuto ancora? 83 Io ti credea trovar là giù di sotto, 84 dove tempo per tempo si ristora».
query.result:
**English:**
79 If before the power in you was finished 80 to sin more, that the hour came to mind 81 of the good sorrow that remarries us to God,
82 how is it that you have come up here again? 83 I thought to find you down there below, 84 where time is restored from time to time."
**Malay:**
79 Jika sebelumnya kuasa dalam dirimu telah berakhir 80 untuk berbuat dosa lebih banyak, sehingga saat itu teringat 81 akan duka nestapa yang baik yang mempersatukan kita kembali dengan Tuhan,
82 bagaimana mungkin engkau datang ke sini lagi? 83 Aku kira akan menemukanmu di bawah sana, 84 di mana waktu dipulihkan dari waktu ke waktu."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
85 Ond’ elli a me: «Sì tosto m’ha condotto 86 a ber lo dolce assenzo d’i martìri 87 la Nella mia con suo pianger dirotto.
query.result:
**English:**
85 Then he said to me: "So soon has Nella, 86 with her bitter weeping, led me 87 to speak the sweet wormwood of martyrdom.
**Malay:**
85 Kemudian dia berkata kepadaku: "Segera Nella, 86 dengan tangisannya yang pilu, telah menuntunku 87 untuk mengucapkan pahitnya siksaan yang manis.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
88 Con suoi prieghi devoti e con sospiri 89 tratto m’ha de la costa ove s’aspetta, 90 e liberato m’ha de li altri giri.
query.result:
**English:**
88 With her devout prayers and with sighs 89 she has drawn me from the shore where one waits, 90 and has freed me from the other circles.
**Malay:**
88 Dengan doa-doanya yang khusyuk dan dengan desahan 89 dia telah menarikku dari pantai tempat seseorang menunggu, 90 dan telah membebaskanku dari lingkaran-lingkaran lainnya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
97 O dolce frate, che vuo’ tu ch’io dica? 98 Tempo futuro m’è già nel cospetto, 99 cui non sarà quest’ ora molto antica,
100 nel qual sarà in pergamo interdetto 101 a le sfacciate donne fiorentine 102 l’andar mostrando con le poppe il petto.
query.result:
**English:**
97 O sweet brother, what do you want me to say? 98 The future time is already before me, 99 to which this present hour will not be very old,
100 in which it will be forbidden from the pulpit 101 to the shameless Florentine women 102 to go about showing their breasts with their bodices.
**Malay:**
97 Wahai saudara yang manis, apa yang kau ingin kukatakan? 98 Waktu yang akan datang sudah ada di hadapanku, 99 yang mana jam ini tidak akan terlalu lama lagi,
100 di mana akan dilarang dari mimbar 101 kepada para wanita Florentine yang tidak tahu malu 102 untuk berkeliaran memperlihatkan dada mereka dengan pakaian mereka.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
103 Quai barbare fuor mai, quai saracine, 104 cui bisognasse, per farle ir coperte, 105 o spiritali o altre discipline?
106 Ma se le svergognate fosser certe 107 di quel che ’l ciel veloce loro ammanna, 108 già per urlare avrian le bocche aperte;
109 ché, se l’antiveder qui non m’inganna, 110 prima fien triste che le guance impeli 111 colui che mo si consola con nanna.
query.result:
**English:**
103 What barbarians were ever so crude, or Saracens, 104 that they needed, to make them cover themselves, 105 either spiritual or other disciplines?
106 But if the shameless women were certain 107 of what the swift heavens are preparing for them, 108 they would already have their mouths open to scream;
109 for, if my foresight does not deceive me here, 110 they will be sad before the one who now consoles himself with lullabies 111 grows a beard on his cheeks.
**Malay:**
103 Orang-orang barbar manakah yang pernah sekasar itu, atau orang-orang Saracen, 104 yang membutuhkan, untuk membuat mereka menutupi diri mereka sendiri, 105 disiplin spiritual atau disiplin lainnya?
106 Tetapi jika para wanita yang tidak tahu malu itu yakin 107 tentang apa yang sedang dipersiapkan oleh langit yang cepat bagi mereka, 108 mereka pasti sudah membuka mulut mereka untuk berteriak;
109 karena, jika pandangan ke depan saya tidak menipu saya di sini, 110 mereka akan sedih sebelum orang yang sekarang menghibur dirinya sendiri dengan lagu pengantar tidur 111 menumbuhkan janggut di pipinya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
112 Deh, frate, or fa che più non mi ti celi! 113 vedi che non pur io, ma questa gente 114 tutta rimira là dove ’l sol veli».
query.result:
**English:**
112 Oh, brother, now do not hide it from me any longer! 113 See that not only I, but all these people 114 are looking over there where the sun sets.
**Malay:**
112 Oh, saudara, sekarang jangan sembunyikan lagi dariku! 113 Lihatlah bahwa bukan hanya aku, tetapi semua orang ini 114 semuanya melihat ke sana di mana matahari terbenam.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
115 Per ch’io a lui: «Se tu riduci a mente 116 qual fosti meco, e qual io teco fui, 117 ancor fia grave il memorar presente.
query.result:
**English:**
115 Wherefore I said to him: "If you recall 116 what you were with me, and what I was with you, 117 the present memory will still be grievous."
**Malay:**
115 Oleh karena itu aku berkata kepadanya: "Jika kamu mengingat kembali 116 bagaimana kamu bersamaku, dan bagaimana aku bersamamu, 117 kenangan saat ini akan tetap menyakitkan."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
118 Di quella vita mi volse costui 119 che mi va innanzi, l’altr’ ier, quando tonda 120 vi si mostrò la suora di colui»,
121 e ’l sol mostrai; «costui per la profonda 122 notte menato m’ha d’i veri morti 123 con questa vera carne che ’l seconda.
query.result:
**English:**
118 He who goes before me turned me to that life 119 the other day, when the sister of him who made you 120 appeared to you round,
121 and I showed you the sun; he has led me through 122 the deep night of the true dead 123 with this real flesh that follows him.
**Malay:**
118 Dialah yang berjalan di depanku yang membawaku ke kehidupan itu 119 tempoh hari, ketika saudari dari dia yang menjadikan kamu 120 menampakkan dirinya kepadamu dalam keadaan bulat,
121 dan aku menunjukkan matahari kepadamu; dialah yang telah membawaku melalui 122 malam yang dalam dari kematian yang sejati 123 dengan daging yang nyata ini yang mengikutinya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
124 Indi m’han tratto sù li suoi conforti, 125 salendo e rigirando la montagna 126 che drizza voi che ’l mondo fece torti.
query.result:
**English:**
124 Then she drew me up with her consolations, 125 climbing and circling the mountain 126 that straightens you out, whom the world made crooked.
**Malay:**
124 Kemudian dia menarikku ke atas dengan penghiburannya, 125 mendaki dan mengelilingi gunung 126 yang meluruskan kalian yang telah dibuat bengkok oleh dunia.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
127 Tanto dice di farmi sua compagna 128 che io sarò là dove fia Beatrice; 129 quivi convien che sanza lui rimagna.
query.result:
**English:**
127 So much does he say to make me his companion 128 that I will be where Beatrice is; 129 here it is necessary that I remain without him.
**Malay:**
127 Begitu banyak yang dikatakannya untuk menjadikan aku sebagai temannya 128 sehingga aku akan berada di tempat Beatrice berada; 129 di sini aku harus tetap tinggal tanpa dia.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
130 Virgilio è questi che così mi dice», 131 e addita’lo; «e quest’ altro è quell’ ombra 132 per cuï scosse dianzi ogne pendice
133 lo vostro regno, che da sé lo sgombra».
query.result:
**English:**
130 “Virgil is this one who thus speaks to me,” 131 and points to him; “and this other is that shade 132 for whom just now every slope trembled
133 your kingdom, which he clears of himself.”
**Malay:**
130 “Virgil adalah orang ini yang berbicara kepadaku seperti ini,” 131 dan menunjuknya; “dan yang ini adalah bayangan itu 132 yang sebelumnya membuat setiap lereng berguncang
133 kerajaan kalian, yang dia bersihkan dari dirinya sendiri.”
